place.name: LLANTRISSENT
place.gazetteerText: LLANTRISSENT, a parish in Pontypool district, Monmouth; on the river Usk, 3 miles S by E of Usk r. station. Post town, Usk, under Newport, Monmouth. Acres, 2,762. Real property, £2,832. Pop., 308. Houses, 59. The property is divided among a few. The living is a vicarage, united with the vicarage of Pertholey, in the diocese of Llandaff. Value, £180.* Patron, the Rev.J. E. Wakley. The church is dedicated to Sts. Peter, Paul, and John; and is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
